content: I don't have personal preferences, but many people would argue that the macarons from ladurée or pierre hermé are an absolute must-try when in paris. these iconic french sweets have a delicate, fluffy meringue shell and a sweet, creamy filling. ladurée is one of the oldest and most famous macaron makers in france, while pierre hermé is a renowned pastry chef who has been called the "picasso of pastry". both offer a wide range of flavors, from classic vanilla and chocolate to more unique flavors like rose, pistachio, and salted caramel. these macarons are an essential treat for anyone looking to indulge in a quintessential parisian dessert.
